I love this. Thanks Everday Astronaut. BTW, Dreamchaser is based on NASA's HL-20 project which was based on the Russian BOR-4. The BOR-4 was a miniature test vehicle that launched into space. It's a really interesting story involving spies. I mentioned some of its history in my blog article back in 2012, Space Planes: https://ideawritesstlaerospace.blogspot.com/2012/09/space-planes.html

Cheers.

Theoretically, making Kerbin flat is pretty easy - ya just need the right heightmap. However, making it "realistic" is a different challenge altogether; you'd need to alter core parts of the game's code just to make it so you don't get pulled towards the center of the planet. It would be pretty fun to mess around with if someone could pull it off.

54:00 reenactment of the first dreamchaser drop test. The nose skid failed for them also.

These repeated launch scrubs for weather are a good illustration of why any SpaceX plans for point to point Earth passenger flights are just nonsense, unless they can find a launch location not subject to high altitude winds (or build a craft that can launch regardless of wind conditions).  People wealthy enough to afford a fast flight half way around the globe are not going to be patient enough to put up with the likelihood of delays to their flights taking off.  The launch site would also have to be in a spot that didn't affect normal air flight traffic so that you didn't have to regularly shut down air space.  Starlink would really seem to be the only feasible way to fund their Mars plans.

I had to laugh. You've been hanging around aerospace types for how long and never seen weather abbreviated to WX? It's been used as morse code shorthand since the 1800s. It's also the call letters of the NOAA radio stations, WX1, WX2, WX3, etc.

I’d rather them scrub a million times and get a completely successful launch and landing than go right off the bat and fail, even if just the landing fails. Scrubs are good guys, and don’t make travel plans around something that isn’t for sure, that’s just a little common sense. AKA SpaceX doesn’t have to work based around its fans’ schedules, it’s the other way around
